repositories.brief_summary: Type system improvements, TSan fixes, and pattern matching enhancements
repositories.new_features_summary: Existential types in as-patterns, improved error messages, and TSan instrumentation fixes
repositories.new_features:
- **Existential types** now supported in as-patterns, completing previous work and lifting restrictions on retyping patterns containing existentials ([#14327](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14327))
- **Recursive module error messages** improved with abstract environment for printing `-short-paths` and added error message for types considered abstract during recursive module checking ([#14037](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14037))
- **Pattern constraint handling** cleaned up by removing legacy hacks, with behavior change that `let rec (_ as x) = ...` is now consistently rejected instead of being treated as `let rec x = ...` ([#14322](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14322))
- **Type-level scope documentation** added with detailed explanation of `Ctype.create_scope` and enforcement of `current_level <= generic_level` invariant ([#14331](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14331))
- **TSan instrumentation** fixed to properly instrument subexpressions and shared heap operations, addressing race detection gaps ([#14332](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14332), [#14335](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14335))
- **Dune build support** restored with fixes for label reordering and iarray availability in OCaml 5.4 ([#14328](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14328))
repositories.activity_summary: 12 PRs opened with ongoing work on type system features and GC improvements
repositories.activity:
- Four **new PRs opened** remain under review: atomic class cache accesses by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333)), GC work accounting fixes by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) ([#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329)), spellchecking hints for module errors by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) ([#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330)), and treating polymorphic variables on let constraints as locally abstract by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) ([#14325](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14325))
- **Type system enhancements** delivered through existential types in as-patterns ([#14327](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14327)), pattern constraint cleanup ([#14322](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14322)), and scope level enforcement ([#14331](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14331)) by [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s), [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls), and [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue)
- **TSan reliability** improved with instrumentation fixes for subexpressions and shared heap by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) ([#14332](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14332), [#14335](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14335)), though race report in tests/parallel/churn led to issue [#14334](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14334)
- **Tooling support** enhanced with dune build restoration by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) ([#14328](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14328)) and recursive module path printing by [Brandon Stride](https://github.com/brandonzstride) ([#14037](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14037))
- Four **PRs closed without merging**: superseded existential types PR ([#14229](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14229)), polymorphic variant specification fix ([#14326](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14326)), aliasing operators proposal ([#9080](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/9080)), and pattern translation fix ([#14321](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14321)) replaced by [#14322](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14322)
repositories.discussions_summary: GC pacing logic meta-issue and Dynlink error handling discussion
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **GC pacing logic** meta-issue opened by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) to track changes and improvements to garbage collection work accounting ([#14324](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14324))
- **Dynlink error handling** discussion initiated by [Fabrice Le Fessant](https://github.com/lefessan) proposing dlclose on error to prevent resource leaks ([#14323](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14323))
- **TSan race detection** revealed issue in tests/parallel/churn leading to investigation and quick resolution ([#14334](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14334))
repositories.trends_summary: Continued focus on thread safety, type system refinement, and developer tooling
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Thread safety hardening** continues with TSan instrumentation improvements and race detection fixes across runtime components
- **Type system precision** work advancing through scope enforcement, existential type support, and better error messages for complex scenarios
- **Developer experience** improvements through better error messages, build system fixes, and documentation of internal APIs
repositories.contributors_summary: 11 contributors delivered features, fixes, and opened discussions
repositories.contributors:
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) merged TSan fixes in shared heap and dune build restoration ([#14335](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14335), [#14328](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14328)) and opened TSan race issue ([#14334](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14334))
- [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) fixed TSan instrumentation oversight and pattern constraint handling ([#14332](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14332), [#14322](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14322)) and opened PR for atomic class cache accesses ([#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333))
- [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s) completed existential types in as-patterns work ([#14327](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14327))
- [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) enforced type scope level invariants and documented create_scope ([#14331](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14331))
- [Brandon Stride](https://github.com/brandonzstride) fixed nontermination in recursive module path printing with `-short-paths` ([#14037](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14037))
- [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) opened GC pacing meta-issue and work accounting fixes PR ([#14324](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14324), [#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329))
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) opened PR adding spellchecking hints for module error messages ([#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330))
- [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) opened PRs for treating polymorphic variables as locally abstract and pattern translation fixes ([#14325](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14325), [#14321](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14321))
- [Fabrice Le Fessant](https://github.com/lefessan) raised Dynlink error handling issue ([#14323](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14323))
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) merged TSan test disabling fix ([#14301](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14301))
- [@mendelsshop](https://github.com/mendelsshop) opened polymorphic variant specification fix ([#14326](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14326))

repositories.brief_summary: Release preparation and bug fixes for 2.5.0-alpha1, plus AppArmor compatibility improvements and build system enhancements
repositories.activity_summary: Six new PRs addressing release tarball fixes, AppArmor support, and build system configuration improvements
repositories.activity:
- **Release tarball fixes** by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) correcting vendored archive placement in 2.5.0-alpha1 affecting OpenBSD builds ([#6765](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6765), [#6766](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6766)) with backport to 2.5 branch
- **AppArmor compatibility** improved through installer script update by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) checking for abi/4.0 support before applying profile ([#6764](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6764)) and [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) refactoring installer with better variable usage and cleanup ([#6760](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6760))
- **Build system configuration** enhanced by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) with draft PR allowing more install directory customization including bindir, sbindir, and datadir options ([#6761](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6761))
- **Dependency updates** with [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) proposing actions/upload-artifact bump from v4 to v5 for Node v24.x support ([#6758](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6758))
- **Test infrastructure** work ongoing with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) adding OCaml 5.4 and trunk to test matrix, blocked by Cygwin trunk job error handling ([#6684](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6684))
repositories.discussions_summary: Issues reported around 2.5.0-alpha1 release problems, AppArmor compatibility, build configuration, and opam behavior edge cases
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **2.5.0-alpha1 release issues** identified by [@madroach](https://github.com/madroach) where -full tarball incorrectly attempts network downloads for dune despite including vendored dependencies, breaking OpenBSD's network-restricted build phase ([#6762](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6762))
- **AppArmor compatibility on Debian** reported by [Boris Yakobowski](https://github.com/yakobowski) where abi/4.0 doesn't exist on Debian bookworm (oldstable), causing parser failures, with discussion about fallback strategies for older AppArmor versions ([#6763](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6763))
- **Build system configuration gaps** highlighted by [@ccxcz](https://github.com/ccxcz) where ./configure --bindir option is not respected by opam-installer, which only supports prefix, mandir, libdir, and docdir ([#6759](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6759))
- **Archive mirrors configuration** design discussion by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) proposing improvements to handle repository archive-mirrors more transparently with deduplication, visibility in opam option, and override capabilities ([#6642](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6642))
- **Version number normalization** issue reported by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) where syntactic differences in version numbers persist across updates, affecting packages with leading zeros ([#6754](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6754))
- **Unpinned package update behavior** discussed by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) where previously VCS-pinned but now unpinned packages still get updated during opam update when they remain installed ([#6682](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6682))
- **Post-message display** enhancement proposed by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) to avoid UI fatigue by not showing identical messages on reinstall/upgrade ([#6683](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6683))
- **Empty switch deletion** issue closed by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) regarding layout upgrade from 2.2~alpha to 2.2~beta removing empty switches, reported by [Louis](https://github.com/Khady) ([#6049](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6049))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on release quality and platform compatibility improvements for opam 2.5, with ongoing enhancements to build system flexibility and user experience
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Release preparation emphasis** with multiple PRs targeting 2.5.0 release quality, addressing build system issues and platform-specific compatibility problems discovered in alpha testing
- **Platform compatibility improvements** addressing edge cases in AppArmor support and OpenBSD build requirements, reflecting broader testing across diverse Unix-like systems
- **Build system modernization** with work toward more flexible installation directory configuration beyond the traditional prefix-based layout
- **User experience refinements** through proposals to reduce UI fatigue, improve configuration visibility, and fix behavioral quirks around package updates and version handling
repositories.contributors_summary: Kate and R. Boujbel led development with release fixes and installer improvements, while community members reported platform-specific issues
repositories.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) fixed vendored archive placement in release tarball affecting OpenBSD builds ([#6765](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6765), [#6766](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6766)), created AppArmor abi/4.0 compatibility check ([#6764](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6764)), proposed dependency update ([#6758](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6758)), reviewed install directory configuration PR ([#6761](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6761)), and reported issues around archive mirrors ([#6642](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6642)), version number normalization ([#6754](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6754)), unpinned package updates ([#6682](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6682)), post-message display ([#6683](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6683)), and lint check gaps ([#6685](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6685))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) improved installer script with AppArmor profile handling, variable cleanup, and better error messages ([#6760](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6760)), opened draft PR for install directory configuration ([#6761](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6761)), and provided dev meeting feedback on multiple issues ([#6642](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6642), [#6049](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6049), [#5484](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5484), [#6682](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6682), [#6683](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6683), [#6685](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6685), [#6686](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6686))
- [@madroach](https://github.com/madroach) reported 2.5.0-alpha1 release tarball attempting network downloads despite including vendored dependencies, breaking OpenBSD builds ([#6762](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6762))
- [Boris Yakobowski](https://github.com/yakobowski) reported AppArmor abi/4.0 compatibility issue on Debian bookworm ([#6763](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6763))
- [@ccxcz](https://github.com/ccxcz) reported build system not respecting --bindir configure option ([#6759](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6759))
- [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk) proposed optimization to reuse loaded opam files in update with auto-upgrade ([#6686](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6686))
- [Louis](https://github.com/Khady) participated in discussion about empty switch deletion during layout upgrade ([#6049](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6049))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) opened automated PR to update actions/upload-artifact dependency ([#6758](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6758))

repositories.contributors:

repositories.brief_summary: Package management improvements for portable lockdirs, Melange documentation overhaul, and cram test enhancements
repositories.new_features_summary: Portable lockdir solver improvements with deduplication and platform grouping, ocamlformat auto-relocking, Melange @all alias
repositories.new_features:
- **Portable lockdirs** now display **dependency solutions grouped by platform** with clear indication of common and platform-specific packages ([#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620))
- **Solver errors deduplicated** when generating portable lockdirs to avoid repeating identical error messages across multiple platforms ([#12642](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12642))
- **Package validation fixed** for portable lockdirs to correctly validate packages when multiple platforms are involved ([#12640](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12640))
- **ocamlformat auto-relocking** now triggers when `.ocamlformat` version changes, ensuring dev tools stay synchronized ([#12605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12605))
- **Dev tool lock directory validation** now detects missing or corrupted entries and provides clear error messages with automatic relocking ([be54d96](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/be54d96f37fab5eaf7f2f3f77750085a55e743dc))
- **Windows arm64 removed** from default portable lockdir platforms since package management doesn't support Windows yet ([#12641](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12641))
- **Melange module compilation** added to `@all` alias in libraries, fixing build workflow issues ([#12628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12628))
- **Virtual library implementation** bug fixed for `dune build @check` that was causing crashes when virtual modules were present ([#12644](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12644))
- **Cram test conflict markers** now allow text after markers and renamed `(conflict error|ignore)` option to `(conflict_markers error|ignore)` for clarity ([#12655](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12655), [#12651](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12651))
- **Melange documentation completely overhauled** for `(using melange 1.0)` with improved examples, promotion workflow explanation, and updated stanza documentation ([#12631](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12631))
- **Tangled source hosting** domain updated from `tangled.sh` to `tangled.org` in documentation ([#12646](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12646))
- **Documentation structure improved** by moving "dune mental model" to top of explanation section for better onboarding ([#12645](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12645))
repositories.activity_summary: Active development on portable lockdirs, RPC system refactoring, cram test improvements, and OxCaml parameterized libraries
repositories.activity:
- **New PRs opened** this week include `-H` flag implementation for hidden modules by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#12666](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12666)), improved cram test suggestions by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12663](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12663)), setup scripts for cram tests ([#12650](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12650)), cross-device link fix for Docker by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) ([#12649](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12649)), and Windows exclusion from default portable lockdir platforms by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) ([#12654](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12654))
- **Package management** work continues with [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) leading multiple improvements including portable lockdir solver error deduplication ([#12642](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12642)), platform-grouped output display ([#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620)), package validation fixes ([#12640](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12640)), and ocamlformat auto-relocking ([#12605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12605))
- **Cram test enhancements** delivered by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) including conflict marker text handling ([#12655](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12655)), terminology cleanup renaming `conflict` to `conflict_marker` ([#12651](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12651)), and ongoing work on location tracking refactoring ([#12335](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12335), [#12657](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12657))
- **Code quality improvements** merged including removal of `open!` directive across 120 files by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12662](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12662)), deletion of redundant RPC functions by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) ([#12656](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12656)), and dead code removal in Modules by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#12635](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12635))
- **Melange support** advanced with [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) overhauling documentation for melange 1.0 ([#12631](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12631)) and fixing `@all` alias compilation ([#12628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12628))
- **Bug fixes** completed including virtual library implementation in top closure by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12644](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12644)) resolving `dune build @check` crashes
- **Infrastructure updates** merged with OxCaml CI migrated to Nix-based workflow ([#12632](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12632)) and Dependabot updating GitHub Actions dependencies ([#12630](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12630))
- **Ongoing development** includes RPC promotion fixes by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) ([#12604](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12604)), parameterized library instantiation by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) ([#12561](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12561)), Merlin file loading improvements by [Will Thomas](https://github.com/Durbatuluk1701) ([#12621](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12621)), and autolocking feature exploration by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12653](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12653))
repositories.discussions_summary: Discussions on lockdir portability, cram test conflict markers, artifact variables for cmt files, and virtual library default implementations
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Cross-device link error** in Docker when refreshing package locks discussed in [#11644](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11644), with fix being reviewed in [#12649](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12649) by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan)
- **Portable lockdir UX improvements** debated in [#11868](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11868) with [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) and [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) discussing default platform sets and whether to enable portable lockdirs by default
- **Lockdir renaming proposal** sparked extensive discussion in [#12648](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12648) about renaming `dune.lock` to `.dune-solution-cache` to discourage version control commits, with mixed opinions on the approach
- **%{cmt} artifact variables** feature request in [#12633](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12633) led to discussion about `.cms` files and future compiler support, with [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) implementing support in [#12634](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12634)
- **Coq modules_flags** parser bug identified in [#12638](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12638) with [Bernhard Schommer](https://github.com/bschommer) reporting inability to specify flags for multiple modules and [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) offering to guide fix implementation
- **Virtual libraries default implementation** bug in [#12636](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12636) reported by [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette) where `dune build @check` crashed, quickly resolved by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) in [#12644](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12644)
- **RPC forwarding EINVAL error** reported by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) in [#12660](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12660) with [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) investigating and creating speculative fix in [#12665](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12665)
- **Setup scripts for cram tests** feature proposed by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) in [#12570](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12570) to automate sourcing of helper scripts, now being implemented in [#12650](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12650)
- **Historic issues closed** this week including 7-year-old [#838](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/838) about build selection variables by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) which [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) noted achieved feature parity in dune 3.20
repositories.trends_summary: Package management maturing with portable lockdir refinements, increased focus on developer UX, and continued OxCaml integration work
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Package management maturation** evident through refined portable lockdir implementation with better error reporting, platform grouping, validation fixes, and auto-relocking capabilities across [#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620), [#12642](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12642), [#12640](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12640), [#12605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12605)
- **Developer experience focus** shown through improved error messages in solver output, better cram test suggestions, clearer documentation structure, and enhanced dev tool lock validation
- **Cram test ecosystem expansion** with multiple enhancements including conflict marker handling, setup scripts feature, location tracking improvements, and better error messages ([#12650](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12650), [#12655](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12655), [#12663](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12663))
- **OxCaml integration continuing** with Nix-based CI implementation ([#12632](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12632)), parameterized library instantiation work ([#12561](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12561)), and tooling analysis for parameterized libraries ([#12536](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12536))
- **Code quality initiatives** including removal of `open!` directive, deletion of dead code, and RPC system refactoring showing ongoing effort to maintain clean codebase ([#12662](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12662), [#12635](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12635), [#12656](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12656))
- **Melange support solidifying** with comprehensive documentation updates for version 1.0 and fixes to core functionality like `@all` alias compilation ([#12631](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12631), [#12628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12628))
- **Release preparation** underway with 3.21.0 tracking issue active ([#12619](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12619)) and various features being finalized
repositories.issues_summary: Two good first issues available for duplicate dependency warnings and corrected file contents command
repositories.good_first_issues:
- **Warn about duplicate dependencies** in package definitions - currently dune allows duplicate dependencies in `(package (name foo) (depends ocaml ocaml))` without warning, should be forbidden ([#2678](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/2678))
- **Add dune command** to get contents of corrected files for expect-tests - would enable custom diff programs to view changes before promotion, needs new command like `dune get-corrected ./src/foo.ml` ([#3883](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/3883))
repositories.contributors_summary: Active contributions from Alizter, gridbugs, rgrinberg, anmonteiro, ElectreAAS, and others across features, fixes, and reviews
repositories.contributors:
- [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) delivered extensive contributions including cram test improvements with conflict marker handling ([#12655](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12655), [#12663](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12663)), virtual library bug fix ([#12644](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12644)), code cleanup removing `open!` across 120 files ([#12662](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12662)), OxCaml CI migration ([#12632](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12632)), RPC error investigation ([#12665](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12665)), and ongoing work on cram location tracking ([#12335](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12335), [#12657](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12657))
- [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) focused on package management with portable lockdir enhancements including platform-grouped output ([#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620)), solver error deduplication ([#12642](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12642)), package validation fixes ([#12640](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12640)), ocamlformat auto-relocking ([#12605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12605)), Windows platform exclusion ([#12641](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12641), [#12654](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12654)), and module aliasing cleanup ([#12643](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12643))
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) contributed `-H` flag implementation for hidden modules ([#12666](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12666)), setup scripts for cram tests ([#12650](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12650)), dead code removal ([#12635](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12635)), changelog updates ([#12639](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12639)), and extensive code review across multiple PRs
- [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) overhauled Melange documentation for version 1.0 ([#12631](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12631)) and fixed Melange `@all` alias compilation ([#12628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12628))
- [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) worked on RPC system cleanup with redundant function deletion ([#12656](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12656)) and ongoing RPC promotion fixes ([#12604](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12604))
- [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) addressed Docker cross-device link errors with lockdir fallback to copy ([#12649](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12649))
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) updated Tangled domain references ([#12646](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12646)) and reported RPC forwarding bug ([#12660](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12660))
- [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) improved documentation structure by moving mental model section ([#12645](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12645))
- [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) continued development of OxCaml parameterized library instantiation ([#12561](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12561))
- [@Durbatuluk1701](https://github.com/Durbatuluk1701) worked on Merlin file loading improvements for multi-executable projects ([#12621](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12621))
- [@shonfeder](https://github.com/shonfeder) opened feature request for excluding test dependencies ([#12658](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12658)) and draft work on config file crash handling ([#12659](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12659))
- [@bschommer](https://github.com/bschommer) reported Coq modules_flags parser bug ([#12638](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12638))
- [@sanette](https://github.com/sanette) reported virtual library `@check` bug ([#12636](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12636))
- [@nojb](https://github.com/nojb) provided code review on `-H` flag implementation ([#12666](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12666))
- [@dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) automated GitHub Actions dependency updates ([#12630](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12630))

repositories.brief_summary: Discussion activity on implicit source positions RFC
repositories.activity_summary: Renewed interest in implicit source positions proposal for call tracing
repositories.activity: - **Implicit source positions** RFC ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/52)) saw renewed discussion with [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) requesting restart of discussions for call tracing functionality, while [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) noted the feature is pending investigation by Jane Street on internal representation changes
repositories.discussions_summary: Discussion on restarting implicit source positions RFC that has been in use at Jane Street
repositories.notable_discussions: - **Implicit source positions** feature discussion renewed by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) who wants simple call traces to identify function uses ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/52)) - the RFC proposes new arrow syntax `loc:[%call_pos]` that automatically fills function parameters with call site positions, useful for monadic bind chains, testing frameworks, and error reporting in embedded languages
repositories.contributors_summary: Discussion participation from Tarides team members on implicit source positions RFC
repositories.contributors:
- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) initiated discussion asking to restart the implicit source positions RFC ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/52))
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) provided status update noting the feature is pending Jane Street's investigation on internal representation changes ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/52))

repositories.brief_summary: Content updates including OCaml Workshop 2025 details, tutorial improvements, and automated blog post additions
repositories.new_features_summary: PPX tutorial documentation improvement and OCaml Workshop 2025 data updates with talks and committee information
repositories.new_features:
- **PPX tutorial clarity improvement** by [Tazmilur Saad](https://github.com/syedtaz) removing redundant information about environment variables and compilation timing to make the advanced topic more accessible ([#3382](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3382))
- **OCaml Workshop 2025 comprehensive update** by [Yasunari Watanabe](https://github.com/yasunariw) adding complete presentation listings with authors and links, full program committee roster with affiliations, and updated video link to ACM SIGPLAN channel ([#3384](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3384))
- **Automated blog content additions** including three new blog posts on WebAuthn/Passkeys implementation, OCaml Weekly News, and OCurrent FLOSS/Fund support announcement ([#3383](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3383), [#3385](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3385), [#3386](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3386))
repositories.activity_summary: Three open PRs under review including Dune package management adoption and compilation targets documentation
repositories.activity:
- **Draft documentation on OCaml compilation targets** by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) describing native, bytecode, and other compilation modes with reference links to Dune manual, currently in draft status with community feedback from [Frédéric Loyer](https://github.com/F-Loyer) suggesting Dune manual cross-references ([#3378](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3378))
- **Backstage OCaml post on opam-repository** by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) explaining how the opam-repository ecosystem works, with extensive community discussion involving [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm), [Thomas Gazagnaire](https://github.com/samoht), [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm), [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers), [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), and [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) about infrastructure funding, maintainer recognition, and ecosystem details ([#3379](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3379))
- **Dune Package Management adoption** by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) migrating the OCaml.org build from opam to Dune's package management system, addressing Docker build issues and performance impacts, with ongoing collaboration with [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) and [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) ([#3281](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3281))
- **Ahrefs success story** by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) adding new case study about full stack web development with OCaml ([#3336](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3336))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on ecosystem infrastructure documentation and build system modernization
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Infrastructure transparency and documentation** reflected in the comprehensive opam-repository governance discussion covering maintainer recognition, funding sources, and ecosystem design principles in the Backstage OCaml series ([#3379](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3379))
- **Build system modernization** with the transition to Dune Package Management representing a shift from opam-based workflows to integrated Dune dependency management ([#3281](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3281))
- **Developer experience improvements** through documentation refinements like the PPX tutorial cleanup that removes confusion for advanced topics ([#3382](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3382))
- **Community knowledge sharing** through OCaml Workshop 2025 content updates documenting talks on topics ranging from mechanically verified garbage collection to secure ecosystem development ([#3384](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3384))

repositories.brief_summary: 33 packages merged including OCaml 5.4.0 stabilization, Binaryen updates, MirageOS releases, and new quantum computing library
repositories.new_features_summary: 33 new packages including qcaml quantum computing, oplot mathematical plotter, cryptoverif 2.12, and multiple Binaryen updates
repositories.new_features:
- **OCaml 5.4.0 stabilization**: Removed avoid-version flag to properly support the released OCaml 5.4.0 by [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) ([#28787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28787)), fixed trunk variant issues by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) ([#28793](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28793)), and added missing conf-unwind dependency for tsan variant ([#28794](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28794))
- **Quantum computing library qcaml 0.1.3**: New experimental library for quantum computing simulation with single qubit states, quantum gates (Hadamard, Pauli-X/Y/Z), measurements with probabilistic collapse, and Bloch sphere visualization by [Elias](https://github.com/elias-utf8) ([#28825](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28825))
- **Mathematical plotter oplot 0.85**: New library for plotting 2D/3D mathematical functions with animation support and LaTeX formula rendering by [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette) ([#28826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28826))
- **Binaryen ecosystem updates**: Multiple releases from v117 to v124 adding OCaml 5 support, esy 0.8.0 compatibility, and requiring jsoo >= 6.0 with node >= 22 by [Oscar Spencer](https://github.com/ospencer) ([#28797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28797), [#28798](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28798), [#28799](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28799), [#28800](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28800), [#28801](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28801), [#28809](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28809), [#28817](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28817), [#28819](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28819), [#28821](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28821), [#28822](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28822), [#28823](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28823), [#28824](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28824))
- **Cryptoverif 2.12**: Updated cryptographic protocol verifier in the computational model by [@bruno-blanchet](https://github.com/bruno-blanchet) ([#28802](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28802))
- **MirageOS 4.10.3**: Improved output file extension handling in Makefile and added solo5 0.10.0 support by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) ([#28785](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28785))
- **Solo5 0.10.0**: Fixes for OpenBSD compilation, MTU detection on TAP interfaces, and .note.GNU-stack section handling by [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) ([#28784](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28784))
- **Conex 1.0.0**: Trust establishment in community repositories now with Ed25519 support and snapshot/timestamp capabilities by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) ([#28773](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28773))
- **Tezt 4.3.0**: Fixed SIGPIPE handling issues causing flaky tests and added scheduler timeout workaround by [@rbardou](https://github.com/rbardou) ([#28791](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28791))
- **Codept 0.12.2**: Alternative OCaml dependency analyzer now supports OCaml 5.4 and tracks external module declarations by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) ([#28780](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28780))
- **QCheck 0.27**: Property-based testing library now with float shrinking bindings (`QCheck.Shrink.float`, `QCheck.Shrink.pfloat`, `QCheck.Shrink.nfloat`) enabling default shrinking for float generators by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([#28808](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28808))
- **Cmarkit 0.4.0**: CommonMark parser supporting 0.31.2 specification with improved task items extension semantics, configurable first heading level for LaTeX rendering, less eager escaping of special characters, and Unicode 17.0.0 support by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) ([#28811](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28811))
- **Mazeppa 0.6.0**: New modern supercompiler for call-by-value functional languages by [@hirrolot](https://github.com/hirrolot) ([#28796](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28796))
- **Regrade 0.1.0**: New automatic homework grader based on regular expressions by [Samuel Mimram](https://github.com/smimram) ([#28758](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28758))
- **Rich-string 1.0.0**: Generic library to enrich built-in string type with new capabilities by [lexa](https://github.com/qexat) ([#28759](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28759))
- **Ansifmt 2.0.0**: ANSI styling library rewritten with rich-string, fixing floating-point comparison issues across architectures by [lexa](https://github.com/qexat) ([#28803](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28803))
- **Flux 0.0.1~beta1**: Composable streaming abstractions with Miou support by [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) ([#28804](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28804))
- **Ppx_minidebug 3.0.0**: Debug logs for selected functions and let-bindings by [Lukasz Stafiniak](https://github.com/lukstafi) ([#28771](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28771))
- **Ppx_matches 0.1.0**: Syntax extension bringing Rust's matches! macro to OCaml by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) ([#28755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28755))
- **Ppx_expect_nobase 0.17.3.0**: Cram-like framework with stripped base dependencies for lighter weight testing by [Dmitrii Kosarev](https://github.com/Kakadu) ([#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790))
- **Passage 0.1.8**: Password manager refactored to remove lwt dependency and use bos by [José Nogueira](https://github.com/thatportugueseguy) ([#28754](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28754))
- **Handlebars-ml 0.2.1**: Handlebars templating engine for OCaml by [Kaustubh Maske Patil](https://github.com/nikochiko) ([#28765](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28765))
- **Pageantty 0.0.3**: Terminal pager for displaying diffs by [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) ([#28749](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28749))
- **Fpath-base 0.4.0**: Fpath extensions for Base, now rejecting relative paths that escape above their starting point by [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) ([#28807](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28807))
- **Fmlib 0.6.1**: Functional library updated to support OCaml 4.14 instead of requiring 5.1 by [@hbr](https://github.com/hbr) ([#28776](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28776))
- **OCurrent 0.7.2**: Ten packages from the OCurrent CI/CD system updated by [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) ([#28789](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28789))
- **Smtml 0.13.0**: SMT solver frontend for OCaml by [@filipeom](https://github.com/filipeom) ([#28782](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28782))
- **Gapi-ocaml 0.4.7**: Google APIs OCaml bindings by [Alessandro Strada](https://github.com/astrada) ([#28781](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28781))
- **MlFront 2.4.2.30**: Thirteen packages for MlFront framework by [@jonahbeckford](https://github.com/jonahbeckford) ([#28779](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28779))
- **Vsrocq language servers 2.3.3**: Two packages for VsRocq and VsCoq language servers by [@vscoqbot](https://github.com/vscoqbot) ([#28783](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28783))
- **Configuration package updates**: Removed old conf-gmp packages failing with newer C compilers by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) ([#28775](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28775)), added post-messages for libpcre3-dev → libpcre2-dev Debian transition by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) ([#28769](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28769)), and improved conf-ffmpeg support for Centos 9 and Fedora 41 using ffmpeg-free-devel package name by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([#28814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28814))
- **Odig 0.1.0**: Relaxed pessimistic constraints on b0 dependency by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) ([#28792](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28792))
repositories.activity_summary: 23 PRs remain open including FFmpeg bindings, additional Binaryen versions, and Windows CI improvements
repositories.activity:
- **FFmpeg bindings 1.2.7** opened by [Casey Reeves](https://github.com/xogium) for eight packages supporting ffmpeg 7 and 8, encountering issues with AVChannelLayout on older platforms like Debian 11, Ubuntu 22.04, and openSUSE 15.6, with related conf-ffmpeg improvements in progress ([#28810](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28810))
- **CI and distribution improvements** with Windows workflow enhancements printing opam variables for debugging by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([#28806](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28806)), OS constraint corrections changing `os != "windows"` to proper `os-family != "windows"` filter ([#28805](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28805)), and ongoing conf-ffmpeg fixes still encountering EPEL repository issues on Centos ([#28814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28814))
- **Package maintainability discussions** including version scheme clarifications for ppx_expect_nobase balancing compatibility with upstream ppx_expect while maintaining `nobase` suffix ([#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790)), x-maintenance-intent policy recommendations for package archiving guidance ([#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790), [#28810](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28810)), and preventive upper bound policy violations discussed ([#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790))
- **Build system compatibility** work addressing opam-2.0 cyclic dependency resolution ([#28808](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28808), [#28809](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28809)), MinGW MSys2 topkg failures affecting multiple packages, FreeBSD/RISC-V warnings-as-errors in libbinaryen ([#28809](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28809)), and dune version bound adjustments for qcaml packages ([#28813](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28813), [#28825](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28825))
- **Repository policy enforcement** including checksum immutability violations requiring new version releases rather than reusing version numbers ([#28777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28777)), dev-repo and x-maintenance-intent field completeness checks ([#28810](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28810)), and strict dependency constraint policy discussions about avoiding preventive upper bounds ([#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790))
- **OpenGL/GLUT dependency issues** affecting qcaml package requiring conf-freeglut addition to fix compilation failures with missing GL/glut.h header ([#28813](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28813), [#28825](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28825))
- **Closed issues** include resolving OCaml 5.4.0 avoid-version flag that was incorrectly preventing use of the released version reported by [Török Edwin](https://github.com/edwintorok) and quickly fixed by [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) ([#28786](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28786), [#28787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28787)), closing OCaml 5.4 preview PR for ocamlformat as no longer needed after upstream merge ([#28716](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28716)), and conf-mbedtls version options PR closed following upstream developments ([#28770](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28770))
repositories.trends_summary: WebAssembly tooling expansion, OCaml 5.4 ecosystem stabilization, and distribution compatibility modernization across package repository
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **WebAssembly ecosystem expansion** with intensive Binaryen/libbinaryen update activity spanning versions 117 through 124 by [Oscar Spencer](https://github.com/ospencer), modernizing OCaml WebAssembly compilation toolchain with OCaml 5 support, esy 0.8.0 compatibility, and updated JavaScript tooling requirements ([#28797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28797), [#28798](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28798), [#28799](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28799), [#28800](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28800), [#28801](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28801), [#28809](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28809), [#28817](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28817), [#28819](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28819), [#28821](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28821), [#28822](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28822), [#28823](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28823), [#28824](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28824))
- **OCaml 5.4.0 ecosystem stabilization** following the October 9th release with avoid-version flag removal ([#28787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28787)), compiler variant fixes ([#28793](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28793), [#28794](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28794)), codept adding 5.4 support ([#28780](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28780)), and packages adjusting version bounds for compatibility
- **Distribution compatibility modernization** addressing Linux distribution evolution including Debian libpcre3-dev to libpcre2-dev transition ([#28769](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28769)), Centos/Fedora ffmpeg-devel to ffmpeg-free-devel package renaming ([#28814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28814)), removing conf-gmp packages failing with modern GCC compilers ([#28775](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28775)), and handling conf-libclang version skew on newer distributions
- **Testing and debugging tooling growth** with new PPX extensions for testing (ppx_expect_nobase with lighter dependencies [#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790), ppx_matches bringing Rust patterns [#28755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28755)), enhanced debugging (ppx_minidebug [#28771](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28771)), improved property-based testing (QCheck 0.27 with float shrinking [#28808](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28808)), and Tezt framework reliability fixes ([#28791](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28791))
- **MirageOS ecosystem evolution** continuing with MirageOS 4.10.3 improvements ([#28785](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28785)), Solo5 0.10.0 unikernel fixes ([#28784](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28784)), and Conex 1.0.0 reaching stability milestone for repository trust ([#28773](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28773))
- **Scientific and specialized computing** emergence with quantum computing simulation library qcaml ([#28825](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28825)), mathematical plotting library oplot ([#28826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28826)), and cryptographic protocol verification tool cryptoverif 2.12 ([#28802](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28802))
- **Repository governance and policy refinement** including increased emphasis on x-maintenance-intent metadata for package lifecycle management, stricter enforcement of checksum immutability preventing version reuse ([#28777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28777)), preventive upper bound policy discussions ([#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790)), and OS constraint correctness for cross-platform packages ([#28805](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28805))
repositories.contributors_summary: 30 contributors including Oscar Spencer with 13 Binaryen PRs, Jan Midtgaard with QCheck and CI work, and maintainers across testing, cryptography, and MirageOS

repositories.brief_summary: Tools exit code handling fixed, test suite concurrency improved, and code formatting updated
repositories.new_features_summary: Fixed exit code handling in jsoo_minify and wasmoo_link_wasm tools
repositories.new_features:
- Fixed **exit code handling** in `jsoo_minify` and `wasmoo_link_wasm` command-line tools to properly propagate error codes instead of calling `exit` directly within exception handlers ([#2121](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2121), [9227923](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/9227923fa863adefbfb5821dd6c2823c3587eea1))
- Fixed **test suite concurrency issue** in lib-unix/common tests by adding file lock and cleanup to prevent race conditions when tests run in parallel ([#2123](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2123), [f89ccef](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/f89ccef0a89461d7d19eea8f1627df4fcb043398))
- Updated **ocamlformat** from version 0.27.0 to 0.28.1 with reformatting across 36 files in the codebase ([#2119](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2119), [ef4983f](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/ef4983f68c87976365cafbef8f62b15dbcc9eec1))
repositories.activity_summary: Ongoing work on Wasm runtime eval access, ppx_js cleanup, and Oxcaml support
repositories.activity:
- **Wasm runtime JavaScript eval** function access implementation by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) remains under review with discussions about optimization behavior consistency between Wasm and JS backends ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- **ppx_js cleanup** work by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) with discussions about location handling and ppxlib version requirements for Jane Street compatibility ([#2120](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2120))
- **Oxcaml support** development continues as draft PR with 11,092 additions across 147 files by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#2105](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2105))
- **Runtime value access** feature to allow direct access to runtime-exported values remains open with naming discussions about the API signature ([#2086](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2086))
- **Cmdliner v2** migration PR was closed after exit code handling was fixed separately ([#2118](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2118))
- Test independence improvement by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) was closed in favor of the more comprehensive concurrency fix ([#2090](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2090))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on tooling reliability and test infrastructure improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Tooling reliability** improvements with attention to proper exit code handling and error propagation in command-line tools ([#2121](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2121), [#2118](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2118))
- **Test suite robustness** enhancements addressing concurrency issues and build directory state independence ([#2123](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2123), [#2090](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2090))
- **Wasm backend development** continuing with runtime feature parity work between JavaScript and WebAssembly backends ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- **Code quality maintenance** through ocamlformat updates affecting consistent formatting across the entire codebase ([#2119](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2119))
repositories.contributors_summary: Three contributors active with tooling fixes, test improvements, and formatting updates
repositories.contributors:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) merged fixes for exit code handling in command-line tools ([#2121](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2121)) and test suite concurrency issues ([#2123](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2123)), participated in discussions on runtime value access API design ([#2086](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2086)) and ppx_js location handling ([#2120](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2120))
- [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) contributed ocamlformat bump from 0.27.0 to 0.28.1 with associated code reformatting ([#2119](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2119)) and opened Cmdliner v2 migration PR that was later closed ([#2118](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2118))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) actively working on Wasm runtime eval function access ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108)), ppx_js cleanup ([#2120](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2120)), and Oxcaml support development ([#2105](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2105))
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) contributed test independence improvement that was superseded by a more comprehensive fix ([#2090](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2090))
- [Nikos Nikoleris](https://github.com/relokin) reported stack overflow bug affecting programs using Menhir-generated parsers in certain web browsers ([#2122](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2122))

repositories.brief_summary: Thread naming support, Flambda2 type system improvements, CI infrastructure upgrades, and DWARF debugging enhancements
repositories.new_features_summary: Thread.set_current_thread_name API, improved locking scheme interface, CI runner upgrades, and metrics collection enhancements
repositories.new_features:
- **Thread naming support** added via `Thread.set_current_thread_name` function backported from upstream OCaml, allowing developers to set thread names for improved debugging in GDB and stacktraces ([#4946](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4946))
- **Extended locking scheme interface** with `caml_domain_send_interrupt_hook` callback for better backup thread interactions in multi-domain programs using non-default locking schemes, improving Python integration support ([#4914](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4914))
- **Native Dynlink fix** for parameterized modules now correctly uses `Compilation_unit.full_path_as_string` instead of `name_as_string` to distinguish compilation units differing only by arguments ([#4935](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4935))
- **DWARF test improvements** with pedantic mode enabled by default and new test coverage for closures, larger data structures, tuples, and bigarrays to prevent regressions ([#4626](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4626))
- **CI infrastructure upgrades** deploying larger GitHub Actions runners across all CI jobs for improved build performance ([#4908](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4908))
- **Metrics collection modernization** translating bash scripts to Python with type annotations and extensible CSV format supporting different metric types beyond artifact sizes ([#4926](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4926), [#4927](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4927))
- **Test infrastructure fix** for swapgil stubs setting `send_interrupt` to NULL for runtime 5 compatibility ([#4933](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4933))
- **Build system cleanup** removing unnecessary VERSION file installation to match upstream OCaml ([#4924](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4924))
repositories.activity_summary: Flambda2 type system work, modality system improvements, DWARF debugging advances, and parameterized modules refinements
repositories.activity:
- **Flambda2 type system enhancement** with relations stored as projections in type kinds, enabling precise tracking during n-way joins for the match-in-match heuristic by [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) with extensive review from [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([#4390](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4390))
- **Profiling infrastructure** for speculative inlining added by [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) to better understand compilation behavior ([#4375](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4375))
- **Domain index exposure** proposed by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) adding `Domain.self_index` API for per-domain array elements to avoid contention, referencing upstream [ocaml/ocaml#13171](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13171) ([#4950](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4950))
- **Linkenv refactoring** by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) removing global state to simplify code and support future work, under review by [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) ([#4947](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4947))
- **Natdynlink performance** improvement using skiplist instead of linked list for module GC roots by [Nicolas Trangez](https://github.com/NicolasT), enabling efficient duplicate checking during dynamic linking ([#4949](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4949))
- **Parameterized modules segfault fix** disallowing aliases to parameter modules to prevent signature substitution issues until transparent ascription is available ([#4948](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4948))
- **DWARF debugging advances** including layout improvements for runtime type information by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916)), shape constructors for unknown types ([#4928](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4928)), function sections support ([#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934)), and phantom variable support by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4595](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4595))
- **Modality system work** with `@@ global` implying `@@ aliased` for borrowing soundness by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)), mod bound parsing refactoring ([#4931](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4931)), mod contended inference ([#4929](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4929), [#4944](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4944)), exceptions crossing statefulness and visibility ([#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891)), and stdlib stateless annotations ([#4839](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4839), [#4930](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4930))
- **Stdlib local annotations** for printing functions by [@tkoukpari](https://github.com/tkoukpari) across multiple iterations ([#4937](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4937), [#4938](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4938), [#4943](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4943))
- **Mixed modules progress** with automatic field reordering by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020)) and unsigned divmod work ([#4936](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4936))
- **Layout system improvements** using `Lambda.layout` for `transl_exp` and preserving levels in `Typeopt.value_kind` by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#4582](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4582), [#4549](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4549))
- **Type system testing** adding jkind subsumption across files test by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) with review from [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#4922](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4922))
- **Backend optimizations** including CFG peephole rules for neutral elements ([#4932](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4932)), float value propagation ([#4879](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4879)), terminator simplification extensions ([#4807](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4807)), and CFG reducibility work by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4920](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4920), [#4921](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4921))
- **Name mangling scheme** development by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) enabling reversible demangling with full module paths for improved debugging ([#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850))
- **Preemption support** ongoing work by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881))
- **Runtime improvements** including memprof configuration on major heap by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) ([#4939](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4939)) and to_cmm illegal reordering prevention by [Guillaume Bury](https://github.com/Gbury) ([#4941](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4941))
- **CI metrics enhancement** for compiler profile data collection by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4942](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4942))
- **Frametables configuration** option for `.lrodata` placement to handle large code sizes by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4905](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4905))
- **Match-in-match heuristic** development with improved naked immediate meets by [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) ([#4374](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4374), [#4394](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4394))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on type system refinements, debugging infrastructure, and modality system maturation
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Type system sophistication** continuing with Flambda2 relations as projections enabling more precise optimization analysis and the match-in-match heuristic requiring careful handling of type variance
- **Debugging infrastructure maturation** across DWARF generation, phantom variables, name mangling, and test coverage indicating production readiness priorities
- **Modality system evolution** with stateless, contended, aliased, and portable annotations being refined through stdlib usage and soundness fixes
- **Parameterized modules refinement** addressing edge cases in Dynlink and alias handling while automatic field reordering enables mixed module support
- **Infrastructure modernization** with Python replacing bash scripts, CI runner upgrades, and extensible metrics collection supporting performance tracking
- **Backend optimization focus** on CFG analysis including value propagation, reducibility checking, and peephole optimizations for better code generation
- **Concurrent programming support** through preemption work, locking scheme extensions, thread naming, and domain-aware primitives
repositories.contributors_summary: 15 contributors with work spanning runtime, type system, debugging, CI, and modality features
repositories.contributors:
- [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) merged Flambda2 type system improvements storing relations as projections with extensive n-way join handling ([#4390](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4390)) and profiling infrastructure for speculative inlining ([#4375](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4375)), with ongoing match-in-match heuristic work ([#4374](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4374), [#4394](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4394))
- [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) backported `Thread.set_current_thread_name` from upstream OCaml with testing ([#4946](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4946)), added jkind subsumption test ([#4922](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4922)), and continues preemption implementation ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881))
- [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) modernized metrics collection translating bash to Python ([#4926](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4926)), made CSV format generic ([#4927](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4927)), and developed CFG optimizations including peephole rules ([#4932](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4932)), float propagation ([#4879](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4879)), reducibility checking ([#4920](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4920)), and terminator simplification ([#4807](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4807), [#4921](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4921)), plus CI profile metrics ([#4942](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4942))
- [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) merged DWARF test enhancements with pedantic mode and new coverage ([#4626](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4626)), contributed shape constructors for unknown types ([#4928](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4928)), and works on layout improvements ([#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916)) and function sections support ([#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934)), with reviews on metrics PRs
- [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) fixed swapgil test stubs ([#4933](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4933)), refactored Linkenv removing global state ([#4947](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4947)), continues phantom variable support ([#4595](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4595)), and develops frametables configuration ([#4905](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4905))
- [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) fixed parameterized modules Dynlink ([#4935](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4935)) and addresses alias segfault ([#4948](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4948))
- [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) extended locking scheme interface with interrupt hooks ([#4914](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4914)) and works on memprof improvements ([#4939](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4939))
- [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) enabled new CI runners ([#4908](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4908)) and added CI warnings ([#4867](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4867))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) removed VERSION installation ([#4924](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4924)) and develops modality system improvements including global/aliased implications ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)), mod bound refactoring ([#4931](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4931)), exception crossing ([#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891)), stdlib annotations ([#4839](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4839), [#4930](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4930)), Lambda.layout usage ([#4582](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4582)), and Typeopt improvements ([#4549](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4549))

repositories.brief_summary: Package maintenance for js_of_ocaml with patch updates and dependency conflict resolution
repositories.new_features_summary: Updated iarray primitives patch and relaxed dune version constraint
repositories.new_features:
- Updated **iarray primitives patch** for js_of_ocaml to align with upstream changes in runtime code structure, fixing patch application failures ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))
- Removed **ppx_optcomp patch** (`js_of_ocaml-ocaml_version-ppx.patch`) across all js_of_ocaml packages that was causing build failures ([#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/20))
- Relaxed **dune version constraint** in `ocaml-variants.5.2.0+ox` from exact version `3.20.2+ox` to allow versions greater than `3.20.2` ([159337c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/159337cc7bf8e58f1cb7db1c2d9e999fcc341d31))
repositories.activity_summary: Package maintenance focused on js_of_ocaml patch compatibility
repositories.activity:
- Fixed **patch validation issues** with js_of_ocaml iarray primitives patch that was failing with recent opam versions' stricter patch validation logic ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))
- Removed obsolete **ppx_optcomp patches** that were causing build failures after being reintroduced, affecting js_of_ocaml-compiler, js_of_ocaml-ppx, js_of_ocaml-toplevel, js_of_ocaml, and wasm_of_ocaml-compiler packages ([#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/20))
- Updated **package dependency constraints** to relax dune version requirements in ocaml-variants package ([a1ea0d3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/a1ea0d33dd5662b89183f751c3fec566d7860b75), [159337c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/159337cc7bf8e58f1cb7db1c2d9e999fcc341d31))
repositories.discussions_summary: Discussion on patch validation logic differences between opam and GNU patch
repositories.notable_discussions:
- Discussion about **patch validation compatibility** revealed that recent opam versions switched to stricter patch validation logic than GNU patch, leading to the resolution that publishing code now uses the same logic to prevent future errors ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))
- Investigation into **ppx_optcomp dependency issues** where patches that had previously been removed returned, suggesting potential interactions with other patch sets that may have introduced ppx_optcomp as a dependency ([#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/20))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on patch maintenance and opam compatibility improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Patch compatibility maintenance** becoming more critical as opam adopts stricter validation logic, requiring alignment between patch generation and validation tools ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))
- **Build infrastructure improvements** to catch patch validation issues earlier in the publishing pipeline ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))
- **Package constraint relaxation** allowing more flexibility in dependency versions for better compatibility ([159337c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/159337cc7bf8e58f1cb7db1c2d9e999fcc341d31))
repositories.contributors_summary: Patrick Ferris implemented patch fixes with review feedback from @dkalinichenko-js
repositories.contributors:
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) authored both PRs this week, fixing the js_of_ocaml iarray primitives patch compatibility issue ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19)) and removing the problematic ppx_optcomp patch ([#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/20)), along with follow-up commits updating opam package constraints ([a1ea0d3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/a1ea0d33dd5662b89183f751c3fec566d7860b75), [159337c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/159337cc7bf8e58f1cb7db1c2d9e999fcc341d31))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) provided code review and investigation support on [#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19), helping identify the root cause of the patch validation issues with opam's stricter logic

repositories.emerging_trends:
