- **OCaml 5.4 adoption** with tooling and infrastructure updated to support the latest OCaml release ([#377](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/377))
- **Synchronization primitive optimization** continuing with both adaptive backoff for mpmcq ([#375](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/375)) and counter-based condition variables ([#371](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/371)) under development
repositories.contributors_summary: Vesa Karvonen drove all activity with tooling updates and performance optimization work
repositories.contributors: - [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) upgraded benchmarks to OCaml 5.4 ([#377](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/377)), upgraded ocamlformat to 0.28.1 with codebase-wide reformatting ([#376](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/376)), enhanced mpscq benchmarks with higher contention testing ([6aaf75f](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/commit/6aaf75fce822eddb9fa8c3632012ec95bb468297)), and continued development on adaptive backoff for mpmcq ([#375](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/375)) and counter-based condition variable implementation ([#371](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/371))

group_summaries.brief_summary: 33 packages merged in opam-repository including quantum computing and plotting libraries; ocaml.org documentation improved
group_summaries.new_features_summary: New quantum computing library qcaml, mathematical plotter oplot, 12 Binaryen updates, and PPX tutorial improvements
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Quantum computing library qcaml 0.1.3**: New experimental library for quantum computing simulation with single qubit states, quantum gates (Hadamard, Pauli-X/Y/Z), measurements with probabilistic collapse, and Bloch sphere visualization by [Elias](https://github.com/elias-utf8) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28825](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28825)
- **Mathematical plotter oplot 0.85**: New library for plotting 2D/3D mathematical functions with animation support and LaTeX formula rendering by [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28826)
- **Binaryen ecosystem updates**: Twelve releases from v117 to v124 adding OCaml 5 support, esy 0.8.0 compatibility, and requiring jsoo >= 6.0 with node >= 22 by [Oscar Spencer](https://github.com/ospencer) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28797), [ocaml/opam-repository#28798](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28798), [ocaml/opam-repository#28799](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28799), [ocaml/opam-repository#28800](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28800), [ocaml/opam-repository#28801](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28801), [ocaml/opam-repository#28809](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28809), [ocaml/opam-repository#28817](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28817), [ocaml/opam-repository#28819](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28819), [ocaml/opam-repository#28821](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28821), [ocaml/opam-repository#28822](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28822), [ocaml/opam-repository#28823](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28823), [ocaml/opam-repository#28824](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28824)
- **OCaml 5.4.0 stabilization**: Removed avoid-version flag to properly support the released OCaml 5.4.0 by [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28787), fixed trunk variant issues by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28793](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28793), and added missing conf-unwind dependency for tsan variant in [ocaml/opam-repository#28794](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28794)
- **Cryptoverif 2.12**: Updated cryptographic protocol verifier in the computational model by [@bruno-blanchet](https://github.com/bruno-blanchet) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28802](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28802)
- **MirageOS 4.10.3**: Improved output file extension handling in Makefile and added solo5 0.10.0 support by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28785](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28785)
- **Solo5 0.10.0**: Fixes for OpenBSD compilation, MTU detection on TAP interfaces, and .note.GNU-stack section handling by [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28784](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28784)
- **Conex 1.0.0**: Trust establishment in community repositories now with Ed25519 support and snapshot/timestamp capabilities by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28773](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28773)
- **Testing infrastructure improvements**: Tezt 4.3.0 fixed SIGPIPE handling issues causing flaky tests by [@rbardou](https://github.com/rbardou) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28791](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28791), QCheck 0.27 added float shrinking bindings by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28808](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28808)
- **Cmarkit 0.4.0**: CommonMark parser supporting 0.31.2 specification with improved task items extension semantics and Unicode 17.0.0 support by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28811](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28811)
- **PPX tutorial clarity improvement**: Removed redundant information about environment variables and compilation timing by [Tazmilur Saad](https://github.com/syedtaz) in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3382](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3382)
- **OCaml Workshop 2025 update**: Added complete presentation listings with authors and links, full program committee roster with affiliations, and updated video links by [Yasunari Watanabe](https://github.com/yasunariw) in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3384](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3384)
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Package repository activity**: 33 packages merged in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) including new scientific computing libraries (quantum computing, mathematical plotting), twelve Binaryen WebAssembly toolchain updates, OCaml 5.4.0 stabilization fixes, MirageOS ecosystem releases, and testing infrastructure improvements in [ocaml/opam-repository#28825](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28825), [ocaml/opam-repository#28826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28826), [ocaml/opam-repository#28787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28787)
- **Website content updates**: Three merged PRs in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) improving PPX tutorial documentation, adding OCaml Workshop 2025 details, and automated blog post additions in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3382](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3382), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3384](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3384)
- **Repository maintenance focus**: Package policy enforcement including checksum immutability in [ocaml/opam-repository#28777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28777), x-maintenance-intent metadata checks in [ocaml/opam-repository#28810](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28810), and distribution compatibility work addressing Debian, Centos, and Fedora package transitions in [ocaml/opam-repository#28769](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28769), [ocaml/opam-repository#28814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28814)
- **Platform compatibility work**: Windows CI improvements in [ocaml/opam-repository#28806](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28806), OS constraint corrections in [ocaml/opam-repository#28805](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28805), and FFmpeg 7/8 binding updates encountering platform-specific issues in [ocaml/opam-repository#28810](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28810)
- **Documentation and infrastructure transparency**: Draft PRs on compilation targets documentation in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3378](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3378) and opam-repository governance post discussing maintainer recognition and funding in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3379](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3379)
group_summaries.activity_summary: Ongoing work includes FFmpeg 7/8 binding updates, Dune package management migration, and infrastructure documentation improvements
group_summaries.activity:
- **FFmpeg bindings 1.2.7** opened by [Casey Reeves](https://github.com/xogium) for eight packages supporting ffmpeg 7 and 8, encountering AVChannelLayout issues on older platforms like Debian 11, Ubuntu 22.04, and openSUSE 15.6 in [ocaml/opam-repository#28810](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28810)
- **Distribution package compatibility** work with conf-ffmpeg improvements for Centos 9 and Fedora 41 using ffmpeg-free-devel by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) still encountering EPEL repository issues in [ocaml/opam-repository#28814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28814)
- **Build system modernization** with Dune Package Management adoption by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) migrating the OCaml.org build from opam to Dune's package management system, addressing Docker build issues and performance impacts in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3281](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3281)
- **Infrastructure documentation** including draft compilation targets documentation by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) with community feedback from [Frédéric Loyer](https://github.com/F-Loyer) suggesting Dune manual cross-references in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3378](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3378)
- **Package maintainability discussions** including version scheme clarifications for ppx_expect_nobase in [ocaml/opam-repository#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790), x-maintenance-intent policy recommendations in [ocaml/opam-repository#28810](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28810), and preventive upper bound policy violations in [ocaml/opam-repository#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790)
- **Build compatibility fixes** addressing opam-2.0 cyclic dependency resolution in [ocaml/opam-repository#28808](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28808), MinGW MSys2 topkg failures, FreeBSD/RISC-V warnings-as-errors in libbinaryen in [ocaml/opam-repository#28809](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28809), and dune version bound adjustments in [ocaml/opam-repository#28825](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28825)
- **OpenGL/GLUT dependency fixes** affecting qcaml package requiring conf-freeglut addition to fix missing GL/glut.h header in [ocaml/opam-repository#28813](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28813), [ocaml/opam-repository#28825](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28825)
- **Closed issues** include resolving OCaml 5.4.0 avoid-version flag reported by [Török Edwin](https://github.com/edwintorok) and fixed by [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28786](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28786), [ocaml/opam-repository#28787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28787)
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Documentation and package coordination**: [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) actively working across both repositories with Dune package management adoption in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3281](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3281) affecting how packages are built and managed, opam-repository infrastructure post in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3379](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3379) explaining the ecosystem documented in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository)
- **Community infrastructure discussion**: Extensive discussion in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3379](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3379) about opam-repository governance involving maintainers [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm), [Thomas Gazagnaire](https://github.com/samoht), [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm), [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers), [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), and [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) who are also active in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) maintenance
- **Tutorial and tooling alignment**: PPX tutorial improvements in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3382](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3382) making advanced topics more accessible while PPX packages (ppx_expect_nobase, ppx_matches, ppx_minidebug) being added to opam-repository in [ocaml/opam-repository#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790), [ocaml/opam-repository#28755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28755), [ocaml/opam-repository#28771](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28771)
- **OCaml 5.4.0 ecosystem coordination**: Compiler stabilization work in opam-repository with [ocaml/opam-repository#28787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28787), [ocaml/opam-repository#28793](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28793), [ocaml/opam-repository#28794](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28794) coordinated with OCaml Workshop 2025 documentation update in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3384](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3384) showcasing recent language developments
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Repository infrastructure and funding transparency**: Comprehensive discussion in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3379](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3379) covering opam-repository maintainer history, funding sources (Tarides, OCaml Software Foundation), ecosystem design principles, and maintainer recognition involving [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm), [Thomas Gazagnaire](https://github.com/samoht), [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm), [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers), [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), and [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri)
- **Package maintenance policy refinement**: Discussions about x-maintenance-intent metadata for package lifecycle management in [ocaml/opam-repository#28810](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28810), checksum immutability enforcement preventing version reuse in [ocaml/opam-repository#28777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28777), and preventive upper bound policy debates in [ocaml/opam-repository#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790)
- **Distribution compatibility challenges**: Discussion of Debian libpcre3-dev to libpcre2-dev transition guidance in [ocaml/opam-repository#28769](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28769), Centos/Fedora ffmpeg-devel package renaming and EPEL issues in [ocaml/opam-repository#28814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28814), and platform-specific AVChannelLayout compatibility problems in [ocaml/opam-repository#28810](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28810)
- **Version scheme and dependency management**: Discussion balancing compatibility with upstream ppx_expect while maintaining nobase suffix in [ocaml/opam-repository#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790), addressing opam-2.0 cyclic dependency resolution in [ocaml/opam-repository#28808](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28808)
- **Build system evolution**: Community discussion about Dune Package Management migration impacts on Docker builds and performance in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3281](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3281) with collaboration between [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) and [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA)
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **WebAssembly ecosystem expansion** with twelve Binaryen/libbinaryen updates spanning versions 117 through 124 by [Oscar Spencer](https://github.com/ospencer), modernizing OCaml WebAssembly compilation toolchain with OCaml 5 support, esy 0.8.0 compatibility, and updated JavaScript tooling requirements in [ocaml/opam-repository#28797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28797) through [ocaml/opam-repository#28824](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28824)
- **OCaml 5.4.0 ecosystem stabilization** following the October 9th release with avoid-version flag removal in [ocaml/opam-repository#28787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28787), compiler variant fixes in [ocaml/opam-repository#28793](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28793) and [ocaml/opam-repository#28794](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28794), codept adding 5.4 support in [ocaml/opam-repository#28780](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28780)
- **Scientific and specialized computing** emergence with quantum computing simulation library qcaml in [ocaml/opam-repository#28825](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28825), mathematical plotting library oplot in [ocaml/opam-repository#28826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28826), and cryptographic protocol verification tool cryptoverif 2.12 in [ocaml/opam-repository#28802](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28802)
- **Testing and debugging tooling growth** with PPX extensions including ppx_expect_nobase with lighter dependencies in [ocaml/opam-repository#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790), ppx_matches bringing Rust patterns in [ocaml/opam-repository#28755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28755), ppx_minidebug in [ocaml/opam-repository#28771](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28771), QCheck 0.27 with float shrinking in [ocaml/opam-repository#28808](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28808), and Tezt reliability fixes in [ocaml/opam-repository#28791](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28791)
- **Distribution compatibility modernization** addressing Linux distribution evolution including Debian libpcre3-dev to libpcre2-dev transition in [ocaml/opam-repository#28769](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28769), Centos/Fedora ffmpeg-devel to ffmpeg-free-devel renaming in [ocaml/opam-repository#28814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28814), removing conf-gmp packages failing with modern GCC in [ocaml/opam-repository#28775](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28775)
- **MirageOS ecosystem evolution** with MirageOS 4.10.3 improvements in [ocaml/opam-repository#28785](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28785), Solo5 0.10.0 unikernel fixes in [ocaml/opam-repository#28784](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28784), and Conex 1.0.0 reaching stability milestone for repository trust in [ocaml/opam-repository#28773](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28773)
- **Infrastructure transparency and documentation** reflected in comprehensive opam-repository governance discussion covering maintainer recognition, funding sources, and ecosystem design principles in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3379](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3379), coupled with build system modernization through Dune Package Management adoption in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3281](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3281)
- **Repository governance refinement** including increased emphasis on x-maintenance-intent metadata for package lifecycle management, stricter checksum immutability enforcement in [ocaml/opam-repository#28777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28777), preventive upper bound policy discussions in [ocaml/opam-repository#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28790), and OS constraint correctness in [ocaml/opam-repository#28805](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28805)

group_summaries.brief_summary: Portable lockdir improvements in Dune, opam 2.5.0-alpha1 fixes, and tooling updates across the ecosystem
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Dune portable lockdirs with platform grouping, Melange @all alias, ocaml-lsp config rename, js_of_ocaml exit code fixes
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Dune portable lockdirs** now display dependency solutions grouped by platform with clear indication of common and platform-specific packages ([ocaml/dune#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620)), deduplicate solver errors across platforms ([ocaml/dune#12642](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12642)), and correctly validate packages for multiple platforms ([ocaml/dune#12640](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12640))
- **Dune ocamlformat auto-relocking** triggers when `.ocamlformat` version changes to keep dev tools synchronized ([ocaml/dune#12605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12605))
- **Dune Melange support** improved with module compilation added to `@all` alias in libraries ([ocaml/dune#12628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12628)) and complete documentation overhaul for melange 1.0 ([ocaml/dune#12631](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12631))
- **Dune cram test enhancements** allow text after conflict markers and renamed option from `(conflict error|ignore)` to `(conflict_markers error|ignore)` ([ocaml/dune#12655](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12655), [ocaml/dune#12651](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12651))
- **Dune virtual library bug fix** for `dune build @check` crashes when virtual modules were present ([ocaml/dune#12644](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12644))
- **Merlin completion fix** for inlined record labels in pattern matching contexts ([ocaml/merlin#1978](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1978))
- **OCaml-LSP configuration parameter** renamed from `for_nested_bindings` to `forNestedBindings` for VSCode compatibility ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1568](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1568))
- **js_of_ocaml exit code handling** fixed in `jsoo_minify` and `wasmoo_link_wasm` tools to properly propagate error codes ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2121](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2121))
- **js_of_ocaml test suite** concurrency issue resolved with file lock and cleanup to prevent race conditions ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2123](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2123))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Dune** led activity with portable lockdir improvements including platform-grouped output, solver error deduplication, and validation fixes, plus Melange documentation overhaul and cram test enhancements across [15+ merged PRs](https://github.com/ocaml/dune)
- **Opam 2.5.0-alpha1** release quality improvements addressing build system issues on OpenBSD ([ocaml/opam#6765](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6765)) and AppArmor compatibility on Debian ([ocaml/opam#6764](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6764))
- **Tooling maintenance** wave across the ecosystem with OCamlformat upgrades to 0.28.1 in [ocaml/merlin#1984](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1984), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1569](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1569), and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2119](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2119)
- **Editor support** improvements with Merlin fixing completion for inlined record labels ([ocaml/merlin#1978](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1978)) and OCaml-LSP renaming configuration parameter for better VSCode integration ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1568](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1568))
- **No activity** recorded for ocaml/ocamlfind, ocaml/odoc, ocaml/opam-file-format, and ocaml-dune/spawn repositories this week
group_summaries.activity_summary: Active development on Dune RPC system, OxCaml integration, cram tests, and opam release preparation
group_summaries.activity:
- **Dune package management** development continues with [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) implementing multiple portable lockdir features ([ocaml/dune#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620), [ocaml/dune#12642](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12642), [ocaml/dune#12640](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12640), [ocaml/dune#12605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12605)) and ongoing PRs for Windows platform exclusion ([ocaml/dune#12654](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12654))
- **Dune cram test ecosystem** expanding with [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) delivering conflict marker improvements ([ocaml/dune#12655](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12655), [ocaml/dune#12663](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12663)), [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) implementing setup scripts ([ocaml/dune#12650](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12650)), and ongoing location tracking refactoring ([ocaml/dune#12335](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12335))
- **Dune OxCaml integration** progressing with [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) migrating CI to Nix-based workflow ([ocaml/dune#12632](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12632)) and [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) working on parameterized library instantiation ([ocaml/dune#12561](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12561))
- **Dune code quality** improvements including [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) removing `open!` directive across 120 files ([ocaml/dune#12662](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12662)), [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) deleting redundant RPC functions ([ocaml/dune#12656](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12656)), and ongoing RPC promotion fixes ([ocaml/dune#12604](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12604))
- **Opam release preparation** for 2.5.0 with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) fixing release tarball vendored archive placement ([ocaml/opam#6765](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6765)) and [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) improving installer script AppArmor handling ([ocaml/opam#6760](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6760))
- **Opam build system** enhancements with [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) adding support for more install directory customization beyond prefix ([ocaml/opam#6761](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6761))
- **Merlin tooling updates** with [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) upgrading to OCamlformat 0.28.1 ([ocaml/merlin#1984](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1984)) and testing OCamlformat patches ([ocaml/merlin#1985](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1985))
- **js_of_ocaml Wasm backend** development with [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) implementing runtime JavaScript eval function access ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108)), ppx_js cleanup ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2120](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2120)), and ongoing Oxcaml support ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2105](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2105))
- **Automated infrastructure** updates with Dependabot bumping GitHub Actions dependencies across [ocaml/dune#12630](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12630), [ocaml/merlin#1982](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1982), [ocaml/merlin#1981](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1981), and [ocaml/opam#6758](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6758)
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **OCamlformat 0.28.1 migration** coordinated across multiple tools with upgrades merged in [ocaml/merlin#1984](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1984), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1569](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1569), and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2119](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2119), with [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) leading the Merlin and OCaml-LSP updates
- **Merlin completion improvements** in [ocaml/merlin#1978](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1978) benefit OCaml-LSP users through Merlin's integration as the analysis engine
- **Dune and Merlin integration** work ongoing with [Will Thomas](https://github.com/Durbatuluk1701) improving Merlin file loading for multi-executable projects in [ocaml/dune#12621](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12621)
- **OxCaml integration** spanning multiple projects with Dune CI migration ([ocaml/dune#12632](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12632)), parameterized library work ([ocaml/dune#12561](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12561)), and js_of_ocaml Oxcaml support development ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2105](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2105))
- **Opam and Dune package management** development with Dune's portable lockdir feature improving cross-platform dependency handling while opam prepares for 2.5.0 release with better platform compatibility ([ocaml/opam#6765](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6765), [ocaml/dune#12641](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12641))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Dune lockdir renaming proposal** sparked debate in [ocaml/dune#12648](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12648) about renaming `dune.lock` to `.dune-solution-cache` to discourage version control commits, with mixed community opinions on the approach
- **Dune portable lockdir UX** discussed in [ocaml/dune#11868](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11868) with [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) and [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) debating default platform sets and whether to enable portable lockdirs by default
- **Dune RPC forwarding EINVAL error** reported by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) in [ocaml/dune#12660](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12660) with [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) investigating and creating speculative fix in [ocaml/dune#12665](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12665)
- **Opam 2.5.0-alpha1 release issues** identified by [@madroach](https://github.com/madroach) in [ocaml/opam#6762](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6762) where -full tarball incorrectly attempts network downloads despite including vendored dependencies, breaking OpenBSD's network-restricted build phase
- **Opam AppArmor compatibility** reported by [Boris Yakobowski](https://github.com/yakobowski) in [ocaml/opam#6763](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6763) where abi/4.0 doesn't exist on Debian bookworm, with discussion about fallback strategies for older AppArmor versions
- **Opam build configuration gaps** highlighted by [@ccxcz](https://github.com/ccxcz) in [ocaml/opam#6759](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6759) where ./configure --bindir option is not respected by opam-installer
- **OCaml-LSP configuration capabilities** discussed in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1568](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1568) with [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) questioning whether capabilities are necessary for configuration parameters
- **Merlin documentation bug** reported by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) in [ocaml/merlin#1983](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1983) regarding document command concatenating documentation for consecutive variant and record entries
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Package management maturation** evident in Dune with refined portable lockdir implementation including platform grouping ([ocaml/dune#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620)), error deduplication ([ocaml/dune#12642](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12642)), and auto-relocking ([ocaml/dune#12605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12605)), while opam prepares 2.5.0 release with platform compatibility fixes
- **Developer experience improvements** across tools with better error messages, enhanced documentation structure, improved IDE integration, and tooling reliability fixes in exit code handling and test infrastructure
- **Coordinated tooling updates** with OCamlformat 0.28.1 adoption across Merlin, OCaml-LSP, and js_of_ocaml demonstrating ecosystem-wide maintenance coordination
- **Platform compatibility focus** addressing edge cases in AppArmor support ([ocaml/opam#6763](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6763)), OpenBSD builds ([ocaml/opam#6762](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6762)), and Windows platform handling ([ocaml/dune#12641](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12641))
- **OxCaml integration progress** spanning Dune CI ([ocaml/dune#12632](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12632)), parameterized libraries ([ocaml/dune#12561](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12561)), and js_of_ocaml Oxcaml support ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2105](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2105))
- **Cram test ecosystem expansion** in Dune with conflict marker handling, setup scripts, location tracking, and better suggestions showing investment in testing infrastructure
- **Wasm backend development** continuing in js_of_ocaml with runtime feature parity work and optimization consistency between JavaScript and WebAssembly backends ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Compiler improvements with thread naming, Flambda2 type system advances, debugging infrastructure, and package maintenance
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Thread naming API, extended locking schemes, DWARF debugging improvements, and CI infrastructure upgrades
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Thread naming support** added via `Thread.set_current_thread_name` function backported from upstream OCaml by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark), enabling developers to set thread names for improved debugging in GDB and stacktraces ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4946](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4946))
- **Extended locking scheme interface** with `caml_domain_send_interrupt_hook` callback by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) for better backup thread interactions in multi-domain programs using non-default locking schemes, improving Python integration support ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4914](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4914))
- **Native Dynlink fix** for parameterized modules by [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer), now correctly using `Compilation_unit.full_path_as_string` instead of `name_as_string` to distinguish compilation units differing only by arguments ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4935](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4935))
- **DWARF test improvements** by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) with pedantic mode enabled by default and new test coverage for closures, larger data structures, tuples, and bigarrays to prevent regressions ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4626](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4626))
- **CI infrastructure upgrades** by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) deploying larger GitHub Actions runners across all CI jobs for improved build performance ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4908](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4908))
- **Metrics collection modernization** by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) translating bash scripts to Python with type annotations and extensible CSV format supporting different metric types beyond artifact sizes ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4926](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4926), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4927](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4927))
- **Dune version constraint relaxation** in `ocaml-variants.5.2.0+ox` from exact version `3.20.2+ox` to allow versions greater than `3.20.2` by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) ([oxcaml/opam-repository@159337c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/159337cc7bf8e58f1cb7db1c2d9e999fcc341d31))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- Week 44 saw concentrated activity in the [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) compiler repository with 15 contributors advancing runtime features, type system improvements, debugging infrastructure, and CI modernization
- Package maintenance work in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) focused on js_of_ocaml patch compatibility with stricter opam validation logic ([oxcaml/opam-repository#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19), [oxcaml/opam-repository#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/20))
- Flambda2 type system received significant enhancements with relations stored as projections enabling precise optimization analysis ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4390](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4390))
- Modality system maturation continued with multiple PRs addressing stateless, contended, aliased, and portable annotations across the type system and stdlib ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4929](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4929))
- DWARF debugging infrastructure saw substantial progress with runtime type information layout improvements, shape constructors, function sections support, and phantom variable handling ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4928](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4928), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4595](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4595))
group_summaries.activity_summary: Flambda2 type system work, modality system refinements, DWARF debugging advances, and parameterized modules improvements
group_summaries.activity:
- **Flambda2 type system enhancement** by [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) storing relations as projections in type kinds, enabling precise tracking during n-way joins for the match-in-match heuristic, with extensive review from [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4390](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4390))
- **Profiling infrastructure** for speculative inlining added by [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) to better understand compilation behavior ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4375](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4375))
- **Domain index exposure** proposed by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) adding `Domain.self_index` API for per-domain array elements to avoid contention, referencing upstream [ocaml/ocaml#13171](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13171) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4950](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4950))
- **Linkenv refactoring** by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) removing global state to simplify code and support future work, under review by [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4947](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4947))
- **Natdynlink performance** improvement by [Nicolas Trangez](https://github.com/NicolasT) using skiplist instead of linked list for module GC roots, enabling efficient duplicate checking during dynamic linking ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4949](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4949))
- **Parameterized modules segfault fix** by [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) disallowing aliases to parameter modules to prevent signature substitution issues until transparent ascription is available ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4948](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4948))
- **DWARF debugging advances** including layout improvements for runtime type information by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916)), shape constructors for unknown types ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4928](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4928)), function sections support ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934)), and phantom variable support by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4595](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4595))
- **Modality system work** by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) with `@@ global` implying `@@ aliased` for borrowing soundness ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)), mod bound parsing refactoring ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4931](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4931)), exceptions crossing statefulness and visibility ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891)), and stdlib stateless annotations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4839](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4839), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4930](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4930))
- **Stdlib local annotations** for printing functions by [@tkoukpari](https://github.com/tkoukpari) across multiple iterations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4937](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4937), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4938](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4938), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4943](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4943))
- **Mixed modules progress** by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) with automatic field reordering ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020)) and unsigned divmod work ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4936](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4936))
- **Backend optimizations** by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) including CFG peephole rules for neutral elements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4932](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4932)), float value propagation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4879](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4879)), terminator simplification extensions ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4807](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4807)), and CFG reducibility work ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4920](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4920), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4921](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4921))
- **Name mangling scheme** development by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) enabling reversible demangling with full module paths for improved debugging ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850))
- **Runtime improvements** including memprof configuration on major heap by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4939](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4939)) and to_cmm illegal reordering prevention by [Guillaume Bury](https://github.com/Gbury) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4941](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4941))
- **Package maintenance** by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) fixing js_of_ocaml iarray primitives patch compatibility ([oxcaml/opam-repository#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19)) and removing obsolete ppx_optcomp patches ([oxcaml/opam-repository#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/20))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Package patches aligned with compiler changes** as [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) js_of_ocaml iarray primitives patch was updated to match runtime code structure changes in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml), with [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) coordinating both repositories ([oxcaml/opam-repository#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))
- **CI infrastructure modernization** with Python metrics collection in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) potentially benefiting package building workflows in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4926](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4926), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4927](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4927))
- **Upstream OCaml synchronization** with thread naming feature backported from upstream [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) to [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4946](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4946)) and domain index proposal referencing [ocaml/ocaml#13171](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13171) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4950](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4950))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Patch validation compatibility** discussion in [oxcaml/opam-repository#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19) revealed that recent opam versions switched to stricter patch validation logic than GNU patch, with resolution that publishing code now uses the same logic to prevent future errors
- **ppx_optcomp dependency investigation** in [oxcaml/opam-repository#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/20) examined how patches that had previously been removed returned, suggesting potential interactions with other patch sets that may have introduced ppx_optcomp as a dependency
- **Flambda2 type grammar review** in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4390](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4390) with [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) providing extensive feedback on type variance consistency and projection handling during n-way joins
- **Linkenv API mutability analysis** in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4947](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4947) with [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) reviewing potential re-entry issues in global state removal
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Type system sophistication** continuing with Flambda2 relations stored as projections enabling more precise optimization analysis ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4390](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4390)) and the match-in-match heuristic requiring careful handling of type variance ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4374](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4374), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4394](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4394))
- **Debugging infrastructure maturation** across DWARF generation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4626](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4626), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916)), phantom variables ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4595](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4595)), name mangling ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850)), and test coverage indicating production readiness priorities
- **Modality system evolution** with stateless, contended, aliased, and portable annotations being refined through stdlib usage ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4839](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4839), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4930](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4930)) and soundness fixes ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891))
- **Parameterized modules refinement** addressing edge cases in Dynlink ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4935](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4935)) and alias handling ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4948](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4948)) while automatic field reordering enables mixed module support ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020))
- **Infrastructure modernization** with Python replacing bash scripts ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4926](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4926)), CI runner upgrades ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4908](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4908)), and extensible metrics collection ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4927](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4927)) supporting performance tracking
- **Backend optimization focus** on CFG analysis including value propagation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4879](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4879)), reducibility checking ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4920](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4920)), and peephole optimizations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4932](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4932)) for better code generation
- **Concurrent programming support** through preemption work ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881)), locking scheme extensions ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4914](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4914)), thread naming ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4946](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4946)), and domain-aware primitives ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4950](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4950))
- **Patch maintenance challenges** as stricter opam validation requires closer alignment between patch generation and application tools ([oxcaml/opam-repository#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Type system improvements, TSan fixes, and renewed RFC discussion on implicit source positions
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Existential types in as-patterns, improved error messages, and TSan instrumentation fixes
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Existential types** now supported in as-patterns, completing previous work and lifting restrictions on retyping patterns containing existentials in [ocaml/ocaml#14327](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14327) by [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s)
- **Recursive module error messages** improved with abstract environment for printing `-short-paths` and added error message for types considered abstract during recursive module checking in [ocaml/ocaml#14037](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14037) by [Brandon Stride](https://github.com/brandonzstride)
- **Pattern constraint handling** cleaned up by removing legacy hacks, with behavior change that `let rec (_ as x) = ...` is now consistently rejected instead of being treated as `let rec x = ...` in [ocaml/ocaml#14322](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14322) by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls)
- **Type-level scope documentation** added with detailed explanation of `Ctype.create_scope` and enforcement of `current_level <= generic_level` invariant in [ocaml/ocaml#14331](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14331) by [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue)
- **TSan instrumentation** fixed to properly instrument subexpressions and shared heap operations, addressing race detection gaps in [ocaml/ocaml#14332](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14332) and [ocaml/ocaml#14335](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14335) by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)
- **Dune build support** restored with fixes for label reordering and iarray availability in OCaml 5.4 in [ocaml/ocaml#14328](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14328) by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Primary focus** on type system precision and thread safety improvements across [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with 6 PRs merged and 4 new PRs opened for review
- **Type system work** delivered existential type support in as-patterns ([ocaml/ocaml#14327](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14327)), pattern constraint cleanup ([ocaml/ocaml#14322](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14322)), and scope level enforcement ([ocaml/ocaml#14331](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14331))
- **Thread safety** improvements through TSan instrumentation fixes ([ocaml/ocaml#14332](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14332), [ocaml/ocaml#14335](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14335)) and atomic class cache accesses under review ([ocaml/ocaml#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333))
- **RFC activity** on [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) with renewed discussion on implicit source positions ([ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/52)) for call tracing functionality
- **GC improvements** initiated with meta-issue tracking pacing logic changes ([ocaml/ocaml#14324](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14324)) and work accounting fixes under review ([ocaml/ocaml#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329))
- **Developer tooling** enhanced through dune build restoration ([ocaml/ocaml#14328](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14328)), better error messages ([ocaml/ocaml#14037](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14037), [ocaml/ocaml#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330)), and internal API documentation ([ocaml/ocaml#14331](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14331))
- **Community engagement** from 12 contributors including core team members from Inria, OCamlPro, and academic institutions
group_summaries.activity_summary: Ongoing reviews for GC improvements, atomic class cache, and polymorphic variable handling
group_summaries.activity:
- **Under review** are four new PRs: atomic class cache accesses by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([ocaml/ocaml#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333)), GC work accounting fixes by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) ([ocaml/ocaml#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329)), spellchecking hints for module errors by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) ([ocaml/ocaml#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330)), and treating polymorphic variables on let constraints as locally abstract by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) ([ocaml/ocaml#14325](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14325))
- **TSan reliability** work identified race in tests/parallel/churn leading to investigation and quick resolution in [ocaml/ocaml#14334](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14334) opened by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)
- **Implicit source positions** RFC ([ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/52)) discussion restarted by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) requesting simple call traces, with [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) noting the feature is pending Jane Street investigation on internal representation changes
- **Four PRs closed** without merging: superseded existential types PR ([ocaml/ocaml#14229](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14229)), polymorphic variant specification fix ([ocaml/ocaml#14326](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14326)) by [@mendelsshop](https://github.com/mendelsshop), aliasing operators proposal ([ocaml/ocaml#9080](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/9080)), and pattern translation fix ([ocaml/ocaml#14321](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14321)) replaced by [ocaml/ocaml#14322](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14322)
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **GC pacing logic** meta-issue opened by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) to track changes and improvements to garbage collection work accounting in [ocaml/ocaml#14324](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14324)
- **Implicit source positions** RFC discussion renewed by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) for call tracing functionality in [ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/52), proposing `loc:[%call_pos]` syntax for automatic call site position tracking useful for monadic bind chains, testing frameworks, and error reporting
- **Dynlink error handling** discussion initiated by [Fabrice Le Fessant](https://github.com/lefessan) proposing dlclose on error to prevent resource leaks in [ocaml/ocaml#14323](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14323)
- **TSan race detection** revealed issue in tests/parallel/churn leading to investigation in [ocaml/ocaml#14334](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14334) by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Thread safety focus** continues with TSan instrumentation improvements ([ocaml/ocaml#14332](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14332), [ocaml/ocaml#14335](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14335)), race detection fixes ([ocaml/ocaml#14334](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14334)), and atomic class cache work ([ocaml/ocaml#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333))
- **Type system refinement** advancing through scope enforcement ([ocaml/ocaml#14331](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14331)), existential type support ([ocaml/ocaml#14327](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14327)), pattern constraint cleanup ([ocaml/ocaml#14322](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14322)), and polymorphic variable handling ([ocaml/ocaml#14325](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14325))
- **Developer experience** improvements through better error messages ([ocaml/ocaml#14037](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14037), [ocaml/ocaml#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330)), build system fixes ([ocaml/ocaml#14328](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14328)), and documentation of internal APIs ([ocaml/ocaml#14331](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14331))
- **GC optimization** work emerging with meta-issue for pacing logic ([ocaml/ocaml#14324](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14324)) and work accounting fixes ([ocaml/ocaml#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Quiet week with activity limited to picos: OCaml 5.4 support, ocamlformat upgrade, and adaptive backoff work
group_summaries.new_features_summary: OCaml 5.4 benchmark support and higher contention testing for mpscq in picos
group_summaries.new_features:
- **OCaml 5.4 compatibility** for benchmarks in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) with Docker image updated to `debian-ocaml-5.4` ([ocaml-multicore/picos#377](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/377))
- **Higher contention benchmarking** for mpscq with 8 adder threads added to test suite in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) ([6aaf75f](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/commit/6aaf75fce822eddb9fa8c3632012ec95bb468297))
- **ocamlformat 0.28.1 upgrade** with reformatting applied across 22 files in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) affecting 248 additions and 289 deletions ([ocaml-multicore/picos#376](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/376))
group_summaries.activity_summary: Picos saw tooling updates and draft work on adaptive backoff for mpmcq; other repositories inactive
group_summaries.activity:
- **Adaptive backoff implementation** for mpmcq opened as draft PR by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) with 217 additions across 13 files ([ocaml-multicore/picos#375](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/375))
- **OCaml 5.4 benchmark support** merged in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) to enable testing with latest OCaml release ([ocaml-multicore/picos#377](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/377))
- **Code formatting standardization** completed in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) with ocamlformat 0.28.1 upgrade affecting entire codebase ([ocaml-multicore/picos#376](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/376))
- **Ongoing condition variable work** continues in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) with counter-based implementation PR from June still in draft status ([ocaml-multicore/picos#371](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/371))
- **No activity** recorded in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio), [ocaml-multicore/domainslib](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/domainslib), [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring), [ocaml-multicore/meio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/meio), [ocaml-multicore/saturn](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn), [ocaml-multicore/eio-trace](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio-trace), [ocaml-multicore/kcas](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/kcas), or [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-iomux](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-iomux) during this week
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Single active repository**: Only [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) showed activity this week with 3 PRs (2 merged, 1 draft)
- **Tooling focus**: Work concentrated on infrastructure updates including OCaml 5.4 support ([ocaml-multicore/picos#377](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/377)) and code formatting standardization ([ocaml-multicore/picos#376](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/376))
- **Performance optimization**: Continued development on synchronization primitives with adaptive backoff for mpmcq ([ocaml-multicore/picos#375](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/375)) and expanded contention testing ([6aaf75f](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/commit/6aaf75fce822eddb9fa8c3632012ec95bb468297))
- **Quiet period**: Eight repositories ([ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio), [ocaml-multicore/domainslib](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/domainslib), [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring), [ocaml-multicore/meio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/meio), [ocaml-multicore/saturn](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn), [ocaml-multicore/eio-trace](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio-trace), [ocaml-multicore/kcas](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/kcas), [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-iomux](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-iomux)) had no recorded activity
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Performance benchmarking focus** in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) with expanded mpscq contention testing now including 8 adder threads to stress test multi-producer scenarios ([6aaf75f](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/commit/6aaf75fce822eddb9fa8c3632012ec95bb468297))
- **OCaml 5.4 adoption** with tooling and infrastructure in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) updated to support the latest OCaml release ([ocaml-multicore/picos#377](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/377))
- **Synchronization primitive optimization** continuing in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) with both adaptive backoff for mpmcq ([ocaml-multicore/picos#375](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/375)) and counter-based condition variables ([ocaml-multicore/picos#371](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/371)) under development

weekly_summary.brief_summary: Type system precision and thread safety in core, compiler infrastructure advances in OxCaml, minimal multicore activity, ecosystem growth
weekly_summary.new_features_summary: Existential types in as-patterns, TSan fixes, thread naming API, Dune portable lockdirs, quantum computing and plotting libraries
weekly_summary.new_features:
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Existential types** now supported in as-patterns, completing previous work and lifting restrictions on retyping patterns containing existentials by [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s) in [ocaml/ocaml#14327](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14327)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Recursive module error messages** improved with abstract environment for printing `-short-paths` and added error message for types considered abstract during recursive module checking by [Brandon Stride](https://github.com/brandonzstride) in [ocaml/ocaml#14037](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14037)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Pattern constraint handling** cleaned up by removing legacy hacks, with behavior change that `let rec (_ as x) = ...` is now consistently rejected instead of being treated as `let rec x = ...` by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) in [ocaml/ocaml#14322](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14322)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Type-level scope documentation** added with detailed explanation of `Ctype.create_scope` and enforcement of `current_level <= generic_level` invariant by [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) in [ocaml/ocaml#14331](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14331)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **TSan instrumentation** fixed to properly instrument subexpressions and shared heap operations, addressing race detection gaps by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) in [ocaml/ocaml#14332](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14332) and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) in [ocaml/ocaml#14335](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14335)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Dune build support** restored with fixes for label reordering and iarray availability in OCaml 5.4 by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) in [ocaml/ocaml#14328](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14328)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Thread naming support** added via `Thread.set_current_thread_name` function backported from upstream OCaml, enabling developers to set thread names for improved debugging in GDB and stacktraces by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4946](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4946)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Extended locking scheme interface** with `caml_domain_send_interrupt_hook` callback for better backup thread interactions in multi-domain programs using non-default locking schemes, improving Python integration support by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4914](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4914)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Native Dynlink fix** for parameterized modules, now correctly using `Compilation_unit.full_path_as_string` instead of `name_as_string` to distinguish compilation units differing only by arguments by [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4935](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4935)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **DWARF test improvements** with pedantic mode enabled by default and new test coverage for closures, larger data structures, tuples, and bigarrays to prevent regressions by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4626](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4626)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **CI infrastructure upgrades** deploying larger GitHub Actions runners across all CI jobs for improved build performance by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4908](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4908)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Metrics collection modernization** translating bash scripts to Python with type annotations and extensible CSV format supporting different metric types beyond artifact sizes by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4926](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4926) and [oxcaml/oxcaml#4927](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4927)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Dune version constraint relaxation** in `ocaml-variants.5.2.0+ox` from exact version `3.20.2+ox` to allow versions greater than `3.20.2` by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) via commit [oxcaml/opam-repository@159337c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/159337cc7bf8e58f1cb7db1c2d9e999fcc341d31)
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **OCaml 5.4 compatibility** for benchmarks with Docker image updated to `debian-ocaml-5.4` in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) in [ocaml-multicore/picos#377](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/377)
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **Higher contention benchmarking** for mpscq with 8 adder threads added to test suite in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) via commit [6aaf75f](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/commit/6aaf75fce822eddb9fa8c3632012ec95bb468297)
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **ocamlformat 0.28.1 upgrade** with reformatting applied across 22 files affecting 248 additions and 289 deletions in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) in [ocaml-multicore/picos#376](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/376)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Dune portable lockdirs** now display dependency solutions grouped by platform with clear indication of common and platform-specific packages by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) in [ocaml/dune#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620), deduplicate solver errors across platforms in [ocaml/dune#12642](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12642), and correctly validate packages for multiple platforms in [ocaml/dune#12640](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12640)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Dune ocamlformat auto-relocking** triggers when `.ocamlformat` version changes to keep dev tools synchronized by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) in [ocaml/dune#12605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12605)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Dune Melange support** improved with module compilation added to `@all` alias in libraries in [ocaml/dune#12628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12628) and complete documentation overhaul for melange 1.0 by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) in [ocaml/dune#12631](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12631)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Dune cram test enhancements** allow text after conflict markers with renamed option from `(conflict error|ignore)` to `(conflict_markers error|ignore)` by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) in [ocaml/dune#12655](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12655) and [ocaml/dune#12651](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12651)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Dune virtual library bug fix** for `dune build @check` crashes when virtual modules were present in [ocaml/dune#12644](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12644)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Merlin completion fix** for inlined record labels in pattern matching contexts by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) in [ocaml/merlin#1978](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1978)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **OCaml-LSP configuration parameter** renamed from `for_nested_bindings` to `forNestedBindings` for VSCode compatibility by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1568](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1568)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **js_of_ocaml exit code handling** fixed in `jsoo_minify` and `wasmoo_link_wasm` tools to properly propagate error codes in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2121](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2121)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **js_of_ocaml test suite** concurrency issue resolved with file lock and cleanup to prevent race conditions in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2123](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2123)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Quantum computing library qcaml 0.1.3** provides experimental quantum computing simulation with single qubit states, quantum gates (Hadamard, Pauli-X/Y/Z), measurements with probabilistic collapse, and Bloch sphere visualization by [Elias](https://github.com/elias-utf8) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28825](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28825)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Mathematical plotter oplot 0.85** offers library for plotting 2D/3D mathematical functions with animation support and LaTeX formula rendering by [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28826)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Binaryen ecosystem updates** delivered twelve releases from v117 to v124 adding OCaml 5 support, esy 0.8.0 compatibility, and requiring jsoo >= 6.0 with node >= 22 by [Oscar Spencer](https://github.com/ospencer) across [ocaml/opam-repository#28797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28797) through [ocaml/opam-repository#28824](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28824)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **OCaml 5.4.0 stabilization** with removed avoid-version flag to properly support the released compiler by [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28787), fixed trunk variant issues by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28793](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28793), and added missing conf-unwind dependency for tsan variant in [ocaml/opam-repository#28794](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28794)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Cryptoverif 2.12** updated cryptographic protocol verifier in the computational model by [@bruno-blanchet](https://github.com/bruno-blanchet) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28802](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28802)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **MirageOS 4.10.3** improved output file extension handling in Makefile and added solo5 0.10.0 support by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28785](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28785)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Solo5 0.10.0** fixes for OpenBSD compilation, MTU detection on TAP interfaces, and .note.GNU-stack section handling by [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28784](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28784)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Conex 1.0.0** enables trust establishment in community repositories with Ed25519 support and snapshot/timestamp capabilities by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28773](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28773)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Testing infrastructure improvements** with Tezt 4.3.0 fixing SIGPIPE handling issues causing flaky tests by [@rbardou](https://github.com/rbardou) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28791](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28791) and QCheck 0.27 adding float shrinking bindings by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28808](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28808)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Cmarkit 0.4.0** CommonMark parser supporting 0.31.2 specification with improved task items extension semantics and Unicode 17.0.0 support by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28811](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28811)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **PPX tutorial clarity improvement** removed redundant information about environment variables and compilation timing by [Tazmilur Saad](https://github.com/syedtaz) in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3382](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3382)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **OCaml Workshop 2025 update** added complete presentation listings with authors and links, full program committee roster with affiliations, and updated video links by [Yasunari Watanabe](https://github.com/yasunariw) in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3384](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3384)

weekly_summary.group_overview:
- __RUMINANT:core__ The **core compiler** group focused on type system precision and thread safety improvements across [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with 6 PRs merged including existential type support in as-patterns in [ocaml/ocaml#14327](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14327), pattern constraint cleanup in [ocaml/ocaml#14322](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14322), and TSan instrumentation fixes in [ocaml/ocaml#14332](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14332) and [ocaml/ocaml#14335](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14335), with 4 new PRs opened for review including atomic class cache accesses and GC work accounting fixes
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ The **OxCaml project** delivered compiler infrastructure advances with 15 contributors working across [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) on runtime features including thread naming in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4946](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4946) and extended locking schemes in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4914](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4914), Flambda2 type system enhancements storing relations as projections in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4390](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4390), modality system maturation across [oxcaml/oxcaml#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889) and [oxcaml/oxcaml#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891), and DWARF debugging infrastructure progress in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916) and [oxcaml/oxcaml#4928](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4928)
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ The **multicore group** had minimal activity limited to [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) with 2 merged PRs for OCaml 5.4 support in [ocaml-multicore/picos#377](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/377) and ocamlformat 0.28.1 upgrade in [ocaml-multicore/picos#376](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/376), plus draft work on adaptive backoff for mpmcq in [ocaml-multicore/picos#375](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/375), while eight other repositories had no recorded activity
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ The **package ecosystem** merged 33 packages in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) including new scientific computing libraries qcaml in [ocaml/opam-repository#28825](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28825) and oplot in [ocaml/opam-repository#28826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28826), twelve Binaryen WebAssembly toolchain updates from v117 to v124, OCaml 5.4.0 stabilization fixes in [ocaml/opam-repository#28787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28787), MirageOS ecosystem releases, and testing infrastructure improvements, with 3 merged PRs in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) improving documentation and workshop content
- __RUMINANT:tools__ The **tooling ecosystem** led activity with [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) delivering 15+ merged PRs for portable lockdir improvements including platform-grouped output in [ocaml/dune#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620) and solver error deduplication in [ocaml/dune#12642](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12642), Melange documentation overhaul in [ocaml/dune#12631](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12631), and cram test enhancements in [ocaml/dune#12655](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12655), while [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) addressed 2.5.0-alpha1 release quality issues on OpenBSD in [ocaml/opam#6765](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6765) and Debian in [ocaml/opam#6764](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6764), with coordinated OCamlformat 0.28.1 upgrades across [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp), and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml)
